greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Given n-th prime p, a(n) = number of primes of the form p * q - 2 where q is any prime < p.
comment: Very similar to A103960. - _T. D. Noe_, Apr 18 2013
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: Table[p = Prime[n]; c = 0; Do[If[PrimeQ[p*Prime[i] - 2], c = c + 1], {i, n - 1}]; c, {n, 82}]
program: let p = a000040 n, q <- takeWhile (< p) a000040_list]
results.author: _Jayanta Basu_, Apr 18 2013
